messages.message: @Varun Jain I am working with Stefanini and they must have some information on using the Converse API.  They are now asking how to delete files that have been uploaded and how to load files from an S3 environment

In the API docs I do not see the capability to do either, are there ways to use the platform file system APIs to accomplish the delete?  Any way for Stefanini to know the folder structure of the uploaded files?

@Dale DeLoy - deleting files and conversations is something that the team is working on right now, and will be shipped soon! In the meanwhile, Iâ€™d let @Balaram pitch in on if / how Stefanini team can achieve their objectives using the current set of platform APIs.

@Dale DeLoy are the customers using AIHub prod environment?

Whether they want to delete only the file or the entire conversation?
@Varun Jain any thoughts on how to leverage an S3 bucket with the APIs.  Do they need to first mount an S3 bucket to the platform and then use a folder?
I am jumping into the middle of this so I don't know where they are using the API.  They want to just delete the files today but I assume the conversation in the future
@Dale DeLoy - can we have a call with them on Tuesday next week (Monday is India holiday) to go over their requests? We can then suggest what is possible with the current set of API capabilities.
